data.text: For the Lord will have mercy on Jacob,
And the people shall take them, and bring them to their place:
And it shall come to pass in the day that the Lord shall give thee rest from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the hard bondage wherein thou wast made to serve,
that thou shalt take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say,
The Lord hath broken the staff of the wicked, and the sceptre of the rulers.
He who smote the people in wrath with a continual stroke,
The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet: they break forth into singing.
Yea, the fir trees rejoice at thee, and the cedars of Lebanon, saying,
Hell from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming:
All they shall speak and say unto thee,
Thy pomp is brought down to the grave, and the noise of thy viols:
How art thou fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning!
For thou hast said in thine heart, I will ascend into heaven,
I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the most High.
Yet thou shalt be brought down to hell, to the sides of the pit.
They that see thee shall narrowly look upon thee, and consider thee, saying,
That made the world as a wilderness, and destroyed the cities thereof;
All the kings of the nations, even all of them,
But thou art cast out of thy grave like an abominable branch,
Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial,
Prepare slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers;
For I will rise up against them, saith the Lord of hosts,
I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water:
The Lord of hosts hath sworn, saying,
That I will break the Assyrian in my land,
This is the purpose that is purposed upon the whole earth:
For the Lord of hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul it?
In the year that king Ahaz died was this burden.
Rejoice not thou, whole Palestina,
And the firstborn of the poor shall feed,
Howl, O gate; cry, O city;
What shall one then answer the messengers of the nation?
